After a clash with their neighbors, the siblings withdraw even further into isolation, cutting themselves off from the outside world.

title: Three Bad Girls Who Find a Gun and Become Vampires
overview: In writer/director Christopher R. Mihm's ode to "teensploitation" films of the 1950s and the cinematic oeuvre of the Coen Brothers, three female juvenile delinquents obtain a firearm and, just for the thrill of it, start robbing the fine folks of New Berlin. Unfortunately, their crime spree takes an unexpected turn after they mug and nearly murder the gambling-addicted pastor of the local church—who turns out to be an immortal, blood-sucking creature of the night! Hijinks ensue when the vampiric padre hires a pair of hitmen to help him retrieve his stolen cash and seek revenge against the three bad girls responsible!

title: 8 Portraits, Scenarios: Death of Reality, Fiction, Truth & Lies
overview: A director attempting to create an unconditionally truthful film becomes obsessed with the topic of death. In an intrusive way he relentlessly pushes dark scenarios of death aimed at his portraitures, creating a tension ridden and emotional set, blurring the lines of experimental docu-fiction drama.

title: Cocoon: A Moth prequel
overview: The story of how Mark came to be the Approval Minister in Moth, and the story of the early stages of the government within the original film.

title: The Therapy
overview: An eccentric psychologist has limited time to experiment with a group of artists, applying unconventional methods to cure their fears, while she herself struggles with a problem that has no solution.

title: Pizza Guy 8
overview: A killer pizza guy is on the loose but starts to realize he's in a horror movie.

title: grab my motorcycle
overview: "i created with deafheaven's dream house in mind. sort of a cinematic process of grieving" - r.c.

title: With Closed Eyes
overview: Upon hearing a favourite childhood hangout spot is getting knocked down, two teenage girls decide to revisit their desecrated theatre of dreams.

title: The Swan Song of Fedor Ozerov
overview: Amid rumors of the impending outbreak of World War III, 25-year-old musician Fedor Ozerov becomes obsessed with searching for his favorite sweater with daisies. He believes that this sweater gives him magical songwriting powers.

title: A Mundane Life
overview: Bo (25) is haunted by their dreams. But these dreams aren't about monsters or ghouls, instead Bo is haunted by the mundane dreams that seem to reflect their mundane life. Bo spirals out of control trying to dream about something else other than brushing their teeth & eating breakfast.

title: Janis Ian: Breaking Silence
overview: In 1965, Janis Ian, a 14-year-old singer-songwriter from New Jersey, wrote “Society’s Child” about an interracial relationship. Recorded and released a year later, the song launched Ian's career, but its subject matter ignited controversy, even resulting in death threats. The fallout plunged Ian into an emotional tailspin–and yet a few years later she emerged from the ashes with an even bigger hit, “At Seventeen.”  Over six decades, Janis Ian gained ten Grammy nominations in eight different categories, saw her song “Stars” recorded by such luminaries as Nina Simone and Cher, and overcame homophobia, misogyny, and a life-threatening illness to produce an indelible body of work that continues to draw audiences around the globe. Featuring Janis Ian, Joan Baez, Jean Smart, Arlo Guthrie, Lily Tomlin, and Tom Paxton, among other icons.

title: Just Be Awesome
overview: With spiralling debts and a partner at the end of her tether, Alex, a mid 40s freelancer, desperately needs some work. A golden opportunity at an absurdly trendy agency offers a way out. But he's going to have to play their game if he wants to land the role.

title: A Mere Encounter
overview: A man and a woman meet in a cafe.

title: We Kill Them All
overview: A young woman travels to a secluded resort where her estranged and criminal father seeks to mend their relationship. Upon her arrival, she and her girlfriend are confronted by dangerous men from her father's past and must fight for their lives.

title: Die Laughing
overview: After being peer pressured to pull a prank at a local carnival, Quinn and her friends are stalked by someone (or something) from the supposedly haunted fun house.

title: Chang Gyeong
overview: "Emotional memories that had formed the ambiguous boundaries between reality and fantasy began to divide exactly in two, and at the same time there was no emotion left on either side of reality and fantasy."  Chang Gyeong is the name of a palace in central Seoul - a palace that was turned into a zoo by the occupying Japanese.

title: Le Charade
overview: A stop-motion psychological comedy set in a run-down 1950s diner. Le Charade follows the final performance of a lonely mime and the psychotic episode that ensues after his imaginary friend breaks up with him and he is forced to re-enter society.

title: My Love Will Make You Disappear
overview: A woman who believes she's cursed meets a troubled landlord while fighting community displacement. As they grow closer, her fear that all her lovers disappear threatens their connection.

title: Heartstorm
overview: A young woman goes on a cathartic journey through memory and imagination inspired by the performers at an open mic.

title: Honour, Fame & Glory
overview: A former boxing coach struggles to live with his life decisions that affected his son and his own.

title: Universe 25
overview: Mott the angel is sent on a holy mission in London and Bucharest. In his search for a mysterious saint, he encounters a world that sends him off course and forces him to face his true identity.

title: Anba Dlo
overview: Nadia is a Haitian biologist living in Cuba, researching local wildlife. Until she receives a visit from deep waters, and the Cuban forest begins to speak in other languages. On that day, Haiti never seemed so far from Nadia.

title: The Legend of Kingdom Come
overview: This feature documentary is an origin story about the beloved 90s-era graphic novel Kingdom Come, going behind the scenes and inside the mind of its creator: comic book legend Alex Ross.

title: breathe, again
overview: breathe into the new.

title: Her, Her Life, The Future...
overview: The life of a couple with the disease of endometriosis, she will have to make a choice, but which one? Do you really know the disease? Do you know who she is and what she does? Passionate about dance, the disease takes a big place, what is the fight she will lead? And what would be your choice?

title: People of the Sea
overview: On the Magdalen Islands, during the short lobster season, fishermen and plant workers ensure the economic prosperity of an entire people. In the reality of a global market driven by the United States, the fragility of the fishing industry is palpable, as is the future of seafaring and island culture.

title: All Quiet at Sunrise
overview: While filming a commercial, Ma Ke, a seasoned filmmaker, remembers a film he ultimately didn't make in his youth: the story of a character who investigates the mysterious disappearance of his mother. In reality, the producer of this abandoned project saw his daughter mysteriously disappear, leaving behind a camera and a few photos. In his imagination, Ma Ke seems to dive into a dream of unsuspected depth. Between memory, reality and imagination, three stories will mingle.

title: Fish
overview: A love-hate relationship between a girl and her pet fish which leads to regret.

title: Magic Farm
overview: A film crew working for an edgy media company travels to Argentina to profile a local musician, but their ineptitude leads them into the wrong country. As the crew collaborates with locals to fabricate a trend, unexpected connections blossom while a pervasive health crisis looms unacknowledged in the background.

title: Ride
overview: A sick and sadistic Uber driver prowls the night looking for his next victims, but tonight, he may have found the one fare he wished he wouldn't have picked up.

title: Confia: Sonho de Cria
overview: Nando dreams of being a great Trap singer, but until his dream comes true, he makes deliveries for Lanchudo, a snack bar in Copacabana.

title: Z Zone
overview: In a remote corner of the world, a group of troubled youths finds themselves whisked away to a mysterious military base after a series of misbehaviors. Expecting little more than a stern reprimand, they are instead thrust into a world of secrets and shadows.  In a desperate bid for freedom, they must unravel the mysteries of the base and confront the sinister forces that lurk in the shadows. But with time running out and danger lurking around every corner, the odds of survival grow slimmer by the minute.  Courage, strength, and sacrifice, would they finally escape the clutches of the base and emerge from the darkness into the light?

title: Anacondas: Silent Scream
overview: A village in the amazon is attacked by anacondas, the village chief knows that the best way to deal with this situation is to call: The Venom Order. Once they arrive there, they will have to face not only the terrible threat but, something that even they don't expect to find.

title: Cascas
overview: Industrial memories of life and death. A fox wanders about the cemetery of images.

title: Jacob Kainen: The Last Expression
overview: This film follows the life of Jacob Kainen, a prolific but often overlooked artist of 20th Century America. From his immigrant upbringing to his rebellious artistic journey in NYC, his leftist ideologies and eventual impact on the D.C. art scene, Kainen's story is one of perseverance and passion. Despite facing challenges like McCarthyism and career limitations, he found solace in his art, especially with the support of his second wife, Ruth. His legacy as an artist's artist and influential mentor endures, shaping generations of artists to come.

title: Tahnaanooku'
overview: Tahnaanooku’ takes an experimental approach to the severing of the relationship between a community and their river.

title: Hobi
overview: While charismatic Hobi is out with his infant son during their weekly daddy day, he tries to sell his car, against his own wishes. Driven by a deep desire to move back to Aruba, and believing he can still save his marriage, he first has to settle some outstanding debts. But during the day, Hobi becomes increasingly entangled in his own excuses and will have to make a difficult choice.

title: The City And...
overview: On a bleak day in midwinter, a girl travels to her city's bus station to meet someone. She travels familiar streets and moves confidently. Her relationship with her city changes when no one arrives on the expected bus. She wanders out of the bus station, noticing her city in a new way.

title: Bobby
overview: Feeling low and having questions about what his family was like, orphan 'Bobby' decides to end his life and embarks on a journey to find his parents.

title: Baby Doe
overview: At 22, Gail gave birth alone and left her newborn in the woods. Decades later, she's arrested for murder, despite claiming the baby was stillborn. This documentary explores the fallout when young women cannot accept the reality of an unplanned pregnancy.

title: Геля
overview: Sanya is a trucker who combines his main job with stealing cars. He and his wife Anya are expecting the birth of a child any day now. Suddenly, Sanya receives an urgent order: the hijacking of a "Gelendwagen" (or simply "Gelya"). And for the sake of a comfortable future for his family, he agrees, promising his wife to be in time for childbirth. But everything is not going according to plan, and the case turns into a conflict with a criminal gang of premium car thieves. Now Sanya faces a task of increased complexity: not only to deal with criminals, but also not to be late to the hospital.

title: В списках не значился
overview: June 21, 1941. Young lieutenant Kolya Pluzhnikov, having received an appointment to a permanent place of service, arrives in Brest. The crowded waiting rooms of the station and the crowd of people weighed down with luggage do not alarm the young man, filled with joyful hopes. Kolya hurries to the location of his unit - the Brest Fortress... The soldier does not have time to enlist in the personnel of the military, and at four in the morning artillery explosions are heard - the war has begun. He was not enlisted in the ranks of the military personnel of the Brest Fortress, but still took part in the first battle in his life, which lasted ten months.

title: Forest Haven
overview: A young woman is given a mission by the spirit of her dead brother to save the life of another and free his soul.

title: Shaman
overview: An old shaman asks the spirits to let him go. He has spent his entire life serving people who demanded that their wishes be fulfilled - sometimes stupid, insignificant and causing harm to others.

title: Eel
overview: Liang’s simple, humdrum life in his deceased father’s dilapidated boathouse on the Shezi island takes a totally unexpected turn when he saves a mysterious young woman from drowning. A woman with her own painful past meets a man haunted by nightmares.

title: The Immaculate Deception
overview: Three girls devise a plan to sneak out of their private Catholic school to help their friend have her first sexual encounter.

title: The Botanist
overview: In a remote village in Xinjiang, a young Kazakh boy named Arsin, who finds solace in the company of plants. He soon meets Meiyu, a spirited Han girl whose unpredictable nature reminds him of a rare, otherworldly plant. As their friendship blossoms, it deepens into a delicate, dreamlike allegory that blurs the lines between reality and the enchanting world of botany.

title: Peaches Goes Bananas
overview: Peaches Goes Bananas takes an intimate look at artist and musician Peaches' playful and intoxicating creative world. Real name Merrill Beth Nisker, Peaches left home and her job as a schoolteacher in Canada with the ambition of making a name for herself in the Berlin Underground, combining sex, punk, and the sweet memory of the early '80s, when disco went underground again.

title: Matando Víbora En Viernes
overview: Ser, a person, fights against depression, anxiety and fear, a dark creature within. Failing to escape from it, he surrenders to this feelings within him, embarking on an internal journey to reconnect with his essence and transform into light.

title: Molt
overview: A man, abandoned and unseen, starts witnessing inexplainable things—each glimpse pulling him deeper into a fate unknown.

title: LEAF Plays the Portland House of Music
overview: Young Portland, Maine-based band LEAF plays their biggest show yet at the Portland House of Music. This short documentary follows them through the hours before, during, and after the show.

title: Soda Pop Spencer Storms Atlanta
overview: When a naive online “soda influencer” is radicalized against the Coca-Cola Corporation by an AI misinformation video, he travels to Atlanta on January 6th to expose the conspiracy. He is joined by his friend/documentarian and a new cameraman hired off of Craigslist to film the journey. But what started as a righteous political cause turns into a nightmare of deceit, libations, and, ultimately, a horrific act of violence.

title: Under the Crystal Sky
overview: In the 1800s American Southwest, an Indigenous family witness an extraordinary extraterrestrial event. The family must confront their fear of the phenomenon while also fending off the encroaching American military.

title: Peaches Goes Bananas
overview: Peaches Goes Bananas takes an intimate look at artist and musician Peaches' playful and intoxicating creative world. Real name Merrill Beth Nisker, Peaches left home and her job as a schoolteacher in Canada with the ambition of making a name for herself in the Berlin Underground, combining sex, punk, and the sweet memory of the early '80s, when disco went underground again.

title: Matando Víbora En Viernes
overview: Ser, a person, fights against depression, anxiety and fear, a dark creature within. Failing to escape from it, he surrenders to this feelings within him, embarking on an internal journey to reconnect with his essence and transform into light.

title: Molt
overview: A man, abandoned and unseen, starts witnessing inexplainable things—each glimpse pulling him deeper into a fate unknown.

title: LEAF Plays the Portland House of Music
overview: Young Portland, Maine-based band LEAF plays their biggest show yet at the Portland House of Music. This short documentary follows them through the hours before, during, and after the show.

title: Soda Pop Spencer Storms Atlanta
overview: When a naive online “soda influencer” is radicalized against the Coca-Cola Corporation by an AI misinformation video, he travels to Atlanta on January 6th to expose the conspiracy. He is joined by his friend/documentarian and a new cameraman hired off of Craigslist to film the journey. But what started as a righteous political cause turns into a nightmare of deceit, libations, and, ultimately, a horrific act of violence.

title: Under the Crystal Sky
overview: In the 1800s American Southwest, an Indigenous family witness an extraordinary extraterrestrial event. The family must confront their fear of the phenomenon while also fending off the encroaching American military.

title: Idyllic
overview: Three generations of one Dutch family, along with the neighbors they encounter, question their lives — from their relationships and the value of their existence to their concerns for the future.

title: Cornell's Box
overview: Artist Tae-yi always gets compared to his best friend, Eun-woo. One day, Tae-yi’s girlfriend commits a sudden suicide. Tae-yi starts finding the truth of her death and discovers that the death is related to Eun-woo’ s secret box!

title: Real
overview: Documentary footage shot in the summer of 2023 by Oleh Sentsov, when his APC was hit by the enemy. Sentsov found himself in a nearby trench and, using radio communication, organized the evacuation of his unit, which was under fire, with ammunition running out. This operation was nicknamed "Real".

title: Fanboy
overview: A young man seeking to embrace a perceived legacy unwittingly sparks a notorious chain of events while visiting his father's alma mater.

title: The More Loving One
overview: Raised in a small town, Antti and Suvi meet at a house party and fall in love, start a band and move to the capital. The more successful the band is, the worse their relationship gets. Their relationship ends and the band breaks up. Suvi becomes internationally successful solo artist Summer Maple. When Antti meets the determined Elisa, who aspires to become a lawyer, there is the promise of a new direction in life. But Suvi and music won't leave him alone. One night, Antti's doorbell rings: Suvi has come to ask him to come with her to New York to record a new album.

title: A Pizza for Three
overview: A remake of the shortfilm Mal Tercio (2022).

title: Your Touch Makes Others Invisible
overview: A Tamil woman loses her son to a supernatural entity plaguing her community in a war torn village in Northern Sri Lanka and intertwining with her journey are real-life testimonies with women whose family members vanished at the hands of military forces during the civil war.

title: Entity
overview: A trio of filmmakers find themselves deep within the woods of upstate NY attempting to search for evidence of a local legend, only to find out some of the group are not all they are cracked up to be.

title: Where's Ebaad 3: Oi Ya Gronk!
overview: A traumatised and grief stricken Gab is recruited by ASIO to assist in the termination of an increasingly volatile old foe, stretching his fragile composure to breaking point in an apocalyptic final showdown.

title: Object of Study
overview: There, Robert Peary, an American explorer, thought more than 100 years ago, that the only way for a human being to reach the North Pole would be to have children with Inuits, "to create a super-race that would combine the Eskimo strength and the shrewdness of the Westerner." Following in the footsteps of this extravagant theory, this film essay marches in search of that super-race.

title: The most hated man in the world
overview: A detective is hired by a strange client to find out the truth behind the birth date of Ana Inosculerb, the most hated man in the world". A man so hated that not even his name can be named without being persecuted by society, a man so hated that his life was not even worth living.

title: Scariest Woman Alive
overview: Two friends retreat to a cabin in the mountains to reckon with their personal demons while attempting to lift each other's spirits.

title: Cotton Candy Bubble Gum
overview: After his mom gets engaged to a vindictive cop, Carter, a 21-year-old mama’s boy still living at home, must secure a paid promotion at his internship by the end of the day or find a new place to live. To land the job, his boss gives him a seemingly impossible list of tasks to complete: get his Jeep detailed (the Jeep gets towed), babysit his teenage son (Carter loses the kid), set up his birthday party (a model ODs on the living room floor), and recover a sex tape (a world-famous rapper kidnaps his best friend after a failed blackmail attempt). If Carter can conquer this wildly chaotic day, he might be ready for the real world after all.

title: Liquor and Life
overview: On a Friday night at a local pub, strangers become friends for one night only, as they bond over hardships, personal problems, and balloons.

title: Number 2
overview: The Queens are back! Facing the prospects of being phased out with their old gags, the team engage in sideline odd jobs to keep their livelihoods aﬂoat. Chee Beng, who is moonlighting as a property agent got into a bad altercation while being humiliated during one of his viewings. The result of this bad PR causes Chee Beng to be expelled from the drag community and barred from performing in Singapore. However, an opportunity arises, a drag competition in Thailand! Chee Beng pushes for the team to compete and regain their former glory while dealing with his rebellious teenage son, Mason.

title: Ilu Ilu 1998
overview: A teenage boy develops romantic feelings for his new English teacher but vying for her love doesn't come without consequences.

title: Ilu Ilu
overview: When it was time of Kevin and Riya's Wedding, Kevin's Father and Riya's Mother runs away and here starts ILU ILU. A 26 year old romantic love story, which revolves around 2 passionate lovers, who gets departed because of the caste and financial situations of their families then. Who now, after these many years meet again accidentally for their children's wedding.

title: Make a Girl
overview: The first feature project by anime artist, Yasuda Gensho, with over six million social media followers. The cyberlove suspense story is set to hit the world!

title: My Dear Theo
overview: My Dear Théo is an intimate frontline diary, which the director dedicates to her son.

title: I Love You, Baby
overview: A young black man's struggle with identity, sexuality, and abuse are explored in a series of vignettes.

title: Yet Another Family Drama
overview: An estranged son gets an unexpected visit from his mother. As old conflicts are reignited, their flames become a fascinating show for a stranger, who just happens to have spent the night over.

title: Pyar Mei Qurban
overview: Pyar Mei Qurban is an Indian Hindi Language film, directed by Zuber K Khan. The film features Zuber K Khan, Imtiyaz Bhat, Ebadat Bhat and Roma Arora in lead.

title: This Goddamned Noise
overview: A large party hall is full of strangers and relatives. Roger navigates through it. Today is his 80th birthday, he fears it might be his last. He´s searching for his two children and he wants to tell them his goodbyes. The noise in the hall intensifies, the children don't care about Roger and the others barely even notice him. This Goddamned Noise is a surreal horror film that reflects on time and purpose in an indifferent world that only makes noise.

title: Pangolin: Kulu's Journey
overview: When Stevie, a baby pangolin, is rescued from death at the hands of poachers in Johannesburg, an investment manager pivots his life to become the animal’s caretaker, teaching him to trust the world again and, in doing so, rediscovers his own purpose. Hand-reared until his release back into the wild, Stevie takes Gareth into his dragon world and together they find freedom and healing in the wild.

title: Ice Aged
overview: Bringing humour, grit, and pure joy to the rink, “Ice Aged” follows six senior men and women from around the world as they pursue their childhood dreams of competitive figure skating. From local ice rinks to the grand stage at the World Hobby Figure Skating Championships in Bavaria, their inspiring journey defies age and expectations. Beautifully filmed over nearly three years, the cameras capture every tear, cheer, and broken bone as these skaters pursue their dreams. Not even a global pandemic can stop them from pushing forward in this fairytale on ice.

title: Sirens Call
overview: In their feature-length debut, Gossing/Sieckmann dive into the merfolk subculture with performance artist and siren Una. Genre elements, fiction and documentary, self-care, political activism and self-chosen identities blend into one another.

title: Mayfly
overview: Four former friends reunite to complete a hike they attempted 5 years earlier, in the hope it will make them hate each other a little less.

title: Pip and Posy's Cinema Show
overview: Come and play with Pip and Posy in their first ever cinema show.  Pip and Posy are the best of friends whose lives revolve around a wonderful world of play.  This special show has seven amazing episodes, interactive games and a singalong. Laugh, play and celebrate friendship with Pip and Posy!

title: Small Talks
overview: Chloe takes a taxi, late one night. When things don't go to plan, she soon comes to realise that her talkative taxi driver has a lot more in common with her than she first thought.

title: Vitrival – The Most Beautiful Village in the World
overview: Noëlle Bastin and Baptiste Bogaert’s gloriously dry comedy, which finds two cops attempting to calm local villager’s concerns over an increasing number of suicides in their otherwise peaceful community, is also a disarming and frequently charming portrait of country life.

title: Small Talks
overview: Chloe takes a taxi, late one night. When things don't go to plan, she soon comes to realise that her talkative taxi driver has a lot more in common with her than she first thought.

title: Vitrival – The Most Beautiful Village in the World
overview: Noëlle Bastin and Baptiste Bogaert’s gloriously dry comedy, which finds two cops attempting to calm local villager’s concerns over an increasing number of suicides in their otherwise peaceful community, is also a disarming and frequently charming portrait of country life.

title: Tiger's Pond
overview: In the sleepy hamlet of Vaghachipani, an under-aged sheperdess is discovered to be pregnant. Her employer who is hellbent on becoming the chairman of the village-council is making every effort to cover it up, resulting in more cover-ups threatening to be exposed. Mentally-deficient, the young sheperdess has no idea what a pregnancy is.

title: Queerpanorama
overview: A gay man impersonates men he has had sex with and brings this new persona with him to his next hook-up. Only by pretending to be someone else can he be truly himself.

title: Bury Us in a Lone Desert
overview: When a burglary takes an awkward turn, a young thief encounters an old man seeking a fatal reunion with his wife. Following the perspective of the thief, we witness his journey of emotions: from getting caught up in an absurd situation to growing a kin-like bond to the old man before fulfilling his final wish. Through this implausible journey, love unfolds with genuine simplicity and a bittersweet ending.

title: The Songbirds' Secret
overview: When 9-year-old Lucie arrives at Bectoile for the vacations, she has no idea of the adventures ahead. Her mother, Caroline, is leading an archaeological dig in the region with her colleague Pierrot. Bectoile is also the town where Caroline grew up, and the scene of a family secret... which Lucie is about to unveil! With the help of her new friend Yann and a very special pair of songbirds, Lucie is determined to delve into her family story. From the underground of a ruined castle to a camper van parked on the edge of the woods, this adventure will lead them from unusual surprises to fabulous discoveries!

title: The Comic Artist
overview: After doing the jump from comic-artist to standup comedian, Simon finds himself forced to return to the world of comics, after a line of surprising disasters.

title: BLKNWS: Terms & Conditions
overview: Preeminent West African curator and scholar Funmilayo Akechukwu’s magnum opus, The Resonance Field, leads her to the heart of the Atlantic Ocean, drawing a journalist into a journey that shatters her understanding of consciousness and time.

title: The Night Time World
overview: Experience four spine-chilling stories woven into one dark and seductive fantasy. A late-night podcaster reveals his own tales of horror as he is pulled into the unspeakable world of an ominous caller who claims to be a vampire. Four unique filmmakers knit their harrowing narratives together to create a film of life, death and resurrection.

title: Tehran, an Unfinished History
overview: Tehran's untold sociopolitical history through rare, unseen film archives spanning over a century.

title: And The Rest Will Follow
overview: Famous film director Levent (45), the honorary guest of Söke Film Festival from İstanbul, is completely unaware of Aliye (25), a housekeeper at the hotel where he is staying. However, Aliye, who is trying to tailor a new life story for herself, knows Levent and his films very well. Aliye’s intriguing story brings together these two distant people with completely different lives. Now, they have to choose between reality and fiction.

title: Charlie Hebdo, Hyper Cacher - Les Trois Jours qui ont fait Trembler la France
Olsen's Day
overview: A production assistant goes on a trip with a strange old man and his son who threatens him but at the same time, gives him the answers he seeks.

title: Unbreakable: The Jelena Dokic Story
overview: The remarkable story of Jelena Dokic – an elite tennis star who beat the best in the world with a mental toughness few could match. Jelena survived the turmoil of being a refugee, the pressure of centre court, and the burden of a volatile father.

title: Shogun's Ninja
overview: New jidai-geki directed by Koichi Sakamoto about two ninja girls.

title: TAFRI
overview: Ved takes Sid into an encounter with Guru who is a hotshot, to save himself and his girlfriend Pari, who is also Guru's sister, to have a better life but things take a dangerous turn.

title: The Red Kiss
overview: Passion brews quietly between Qin Qin and Vicky, as they rehearse for the school anniversary drama performance in their form 5 summer holiday. The two girls gradually lose in their exquisite tension and growing intimacy. Right before the new school year begins, the kissing plot is exposed and their show is banned. Yet, it unfolds Qin Qin’s courage that she decides to make a bold move on the first school day.

title: The Initiation
overview: The Initiation follows Nivedita, a young woman trapped in a relationship that no longer feels right. Struggling to express herself, she finally gathers the courage to confront her boyfriend, Vinay. What starts as an honest conversation soon turns into a heated exchange—Vinay refuses to accept the breakup, shifting between denial, guilt, and anger. But just as Nivedita is about to walk away, she hesitates. Fear of change holds her back, and instead of ending things, she delays the inevitable. A raw and emotional take on love, self-worth, and the difficulty of letting go.

title: Candleyes
overview: A man enters a basement and encounters Candleyes.

title: Strappi
overview: Annalisa and Martina, 17-year-old childhood friends, have always shared every moment of their lives together. When Martina needs to get ready for her first date with a boy, she goes to Annalisa's house for help. But Annalisa has always had a crush on her, and as she helps Martina get ready, her jealousy and her feelings start to surface, putting their friendship to the test.

title: Alien Story 2
overview: Two alien siblings cruise the cosmos and relax together over some found footage unearthed from a nearby planet.

title: Famiglia Imbarazzi - La maledizione dello zoccolo
Schönheit
overview: As people overrun tourist attractions, the inherent beauty crumbles to dust.

title: Schmeichel
overview: A Goalkeeper in the Danish football team that won the European Championships against all the odds in 1992 and captained Manchester United in the Champions League final victory that clinched the treble in 1999.

title: the making of liked
overview: Director Kylie Roseanne takes us behind the scenes of the horror short film, "liked".

title: You Got Something on Your Shirt
overview: After David falls for a classic trick at a party, he decides to trick someone else with it - by any means necessary.

title: Let's Meet
overview: TV actor Nikhil connects with finance professional Priya on social media. Their online friendship blossoms until his overeager action pushes her away. He hopes for a chance to restore their connection.

title: The Boy on the Lighthouse
overview: A young widow and an orphan boy are drawn together by grief when he stops her from walking into the sea, perhaps to join her husband’s ashes.

title: Mukhoshe Manushe Khela
overview: Joy Sanyal, a businessman, gets caught in a web of murder conspiracies woven by his rivals.

title: The SwissGrip Project
overview: In February of 1997, two student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Black Mountain, North Carolina while shooting a documentary. They were looking for an urban legend known as 'SwissGrip.'

title: An Artist's Soul
overview: Squeezing out every drop of opportunity she has left, a young actress in the final rounds of her dream drama school audition is willing to risk and sacrifice everything (and everyone) to get what she desires.

title: Dashoi June
overview: 'Dashoi June' is a suspense thriller that revolves around the story of the female protagonist who finds herself alone in her house one day with an escaped murderer.

title: Air France : Une techno de haut vol
Prisoners of Fire
overview: June 26,1990, the Dude Fire rages across Zane Gray country in the towering ponderosa forests below the Mogollon Rim in Central Arizona, killing five prison crew members and a female supervisor on her first fire. Follow along with the survivors and firefighters as they share their experience as inmate firefighters and their harrowing story of courage, loss and redemption.

title: Azza
overview: An existential road movie from Saudi Arabia where a brave woman is determined to create a life on her own terms. A close friendship with a filmmaker opens the door to new horizons.

title: We Live Here Now
overview: Abandoned by the roommate she'd been expecting to live with, Caroline finds herself stuck in a new city alone, in an apartment and neighborhood she can’t afford.

title: I Am Sorry
overview: The confession of a young drug addict

title: OLIVE PLACE, Luxury Inn
overview: OLIVE PLACE is a cartoon about Burt & Belle, lowly porters that live & work at the creature filled Hotel. Each day they run the gauntlet trying to serve the weird & wonderful guests, overcome peculiar challenges & solve the mysteries that lurk within the doors of OLIVE PLACE...but what lies beyond?

title: Isaac
overview: Isaac travels to Mount Moriah with his father to make a sacrifice to God.

title: La véritable histoire du Comte de Menthe et Cristaux
overview: The true story of Pierre Chabrier, alias the Count of Mint and Crystal.

title: Centered: Joe Lieberman
overview: In a time of deep political division, Centered: Joe Lieberman chronicles the remarkable career of Joe Lieberman, a principled and bipartisan politician who navigated the tumultuous world of American politics with unwavering integrity, offering timely lessons on the power of collaboration and leadership beyond party lines.

title: Karon Greece Amader Desh Na Athoba Blue-Black O Transparent White
overview: As Sudipta, a frustrated filmmaker, is forced to make a subpar thriller to appease his producer, tensions escalate, pushing him to a breaking point.

title: Karusela
overview: A group of friends reunite. Their hangout evokes feelings of self doubt and toxic masculine traits - the night spirals out of control

title: Tocotronic at Columbia Theater in Berlin
overview: Golden Years begins with a farewell that is not a farewell. No goodbye is forever, is it? Tocotronic are concerned with the self-contradictions of our existence in an ever more refined way. For the 75th edition of the Berlinale, Tocotronic celebrates the start of its fourth decade as a band at the Columbia Theater.

title: Stuart Laws? Is That Guy Still Going?
overview: The Ruislip-based stand up has resolved to tell the truth, the whole truth and almost nothing but the truth. After an argument with his therapist about being too closed off, Stuart has resolved to come clean: sperm and all.

title: Fadzri Rashid: So, How?
overview: Fakkah Fuzz goes by Fadzri Rashid on comedy specials

title: ReRooted
overview: A bored warehouse worker's quest for an enduring legacy as an animator takes a darkly comedic turn when she signs up for an eco-friendly burial.

title: Frontline: The Battle for Britain's Minds
overview: A documentary about growing political polarisation in the UK. Featuring interviews with the general public, academics, public figures and social media influencers.

title: All Hail the Duck King
overview: When Bill struggles with artist’s block, a figure from his past emerges - leading him on a journey to embrace his true self.

title: Shay au Zénith de Paris - La Villette
Basi Bala
overview: Anxious overachiever Ben clashes with his carefree best friend Miguel when a birthday surprise gone wrong reveals their contrasting perspectives, forcing Ben to confront his fears and learn to embrace life's spontaneity.

title: SOMNAMBULIST-AWAKEN MAN
overview: Delve deep into the fractured mind of a man who walks in his dreams.  Introducing our low budget short film 'SOMNAMBULIST- AWAKEN MAN'.

title: Hoodie Girls Gang
overview: Kayla's boyfriend Jamal is jailed and needs $10,000 bail. Desperate, Kayla and her friends plan an armed robbery. However, the heist goes wrong, and the police are on their trail. To make matters worse, Jamal's boss, Sean, demands payment for the drugs Jamal was transporting. Kayla must now free Jamal and escape town before both the police and Sean catch up to her.

title: Curfew: Sins of the Father
overview: Former police captain Thomas Cooper, once a respected figure, finds himself entangled in a dangerous deal with a notorious crime boss. His involvement leads to a love triangle and ultimately a betrayal. Now, haunted by his past, Thomas must confront the consequences when his son, Christian, becomes a target of the crime boss's revenge.

title: No Politics At the Dining Table
overview: Installation video "No Politics At the Dining Table" emerges as a visual response to a literary text and a question posed by Palestinian writer Mourid Barghouti. Through a semiotic, phenomenological lens the work explores the dining table as a symbolic site of power, control, and negotiation- acting as a microcosm of family dynamic and a metaphor for global power structures.

title: My Eyes!
overview: Peer pressure and personal limits are put to the test when two game ‘witches’ set a group of new students an orientation week task deep in the woods.

title: On the Aftermath of Domestic Hyper-Interiority
overview: The artwork titled "On the Aftermath of Domestic Hyper-Interiority" treats an emotional landscape woven into the core of our existence at home. This work employs the collection of eight short scenes, each one lasting one minute, taken within a domestic settig, inspired by still life images, paintings, and photograhs, along with a ninth screen featuring a text.

title: Eyes On Me
overview: A young woman, haunted by an ever-present, invisible gaze, spirals into paranoia as she tries to escape its relentless surveillance. No matter where she hides, eyes follows, amplifying her fear and unraveling her sense of self.

title: The Apple Music Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show Starring Kendrick Lamar
overview: Watch hip-hop’s MVP put on an epic performance at the Apple Music Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show.

title: Enough
overview: Enough follows a person trapped in mobile addiction, leading to laziness and lost productivity. Struggling to break free, they turn to music as a way to regain focus and reclaim control over their life. The film explores the journey of overcoming digital dependency and finding motivation.

title: Black Heat
overview: After failing to get help from authorities, two parents go on a suicide mission to rescue their fifteen-year-old daughter, who’s under the control of the enigmatic King David.

title: The Dark Mother II
overview: Doeun returned to his past life and the time when his first love, Noun, was still with him. However, in this journey back, his memory of Noun is limited to knowing she is a ghost and not his lover in the sense of a husband and wife relationship. Despite this, he feels a strong connection and begins to question whether the Noun he encounters now is a human or a ghost. He remembers that the Noun he knew as a ghost had already married and given birth to her fourth child. Yet, the Noun he meets in this timeline has not reached that point in her life. Will he be able to change her fate?

title: Redouane Bougheraba - Du Panier à l'Orange Vélodrome
Of Pentacles
overview: Two young adults project their ideals (and, in turn, their problems) onto each other

title: Uncaged
overview: A young NIL athlete confronts anxiety, identity, and survivor’s guilt in a symbolic therapy session, exposing the hidden costs of success and the mental toll of balancing pressure with opportunity.

title: The Newlyweds: Blood at the Altar
overview: On their wedding day, a couple must battle the people they love for their marriage to survive -- literally.

title: Viki323
overview: Suffering from writer’s block, a filmmaker struggles to meet a deadline. Convinced by her husband to use an AI source, they unearthed more than they bargain for.

title: The Making of Medicina Para Fantasmas
Born in the Struggle
overview: Children of Black Power activists reflect on their upbringing, exploring how their parents’ revolutionary spirit shaped their lives, identities, and enduring fight against injustice.

title: Post-Atlantic: The Art of Dewey Crumpler
overview: POST ATLANTIC explores the visionary world of legendary African American painter and philosopher Dewey Crumpler as he connects the slave trade to modern globalization and demonstrates what it means to be a working artist with a conscience in today’s society.
